TopicTitle: What will you do first in 1.0?

Articles.Content: At first? I'll probably have a terrible time re-learning how to build rockets and planes now that the air flows the way it should. But after that, I'm going to seriously consider broadening my space program to include interplanetary explorations.

My kerbal equivalent of the Delta II rocket.

I already tried this in 0.25 but I could never get the engine fuel flow to expend the way I wanted without manually disabling it for each engine... and it wasn't possible to action-group it. I had gotten the 9 boosters okay tho. The problem is that the small liquid fuel boosters where dumping into the main fuel tank from the get go, and I didn't want that. But if I didn't put a fuel line, I couldn't activate the transfer later.

Still with the new aero, it might be worth a re-try. If I cannot make it work, I'll ask 5th Horseman (or the forum) for help =)

What's not to like about the Delta-II ?

![585239main_grail_onpad20110908-full.jpg](http://www.nasa.gov/images/content/585239main_grail_onpad20110908-full.jpg)

I'll probably stick a capsule on an SRB and hit that first mission target of 10km or whatever it is.

After that, grind my way through the science tree.

Then I'll be looking to build an SSTO with the Mk3 parts, that can put an orange tank into orbit.

Try to not kill Jeb this time around.

The key word is "Try".
I will fill two command pods, one with nothing but males and the other with females and smash them together for...er...um....science?
Career mode and hopefully not failing too badly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Fire Jeb, Bob and Bill, hire an all female crew, and start building an all female colony on Eve.

After that, you could start an all male colony on Duna. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Construct a rocket and see it explode on the launchpad

> 
> Test out some of the changes while I wait for roverdude to make his awesome mods work....
> And then go back to 0.9 while i wait for the rest of the mods I will still want.. TAC-LS, Remotetech, etc...

Should not be much of a wait ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) I try to have my stuff ready to go pretty briskly post-release.

Oh... and I'll be launching a new life support mod with 1.0 ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I will be making explosions \*Evil grin\*

Also trying out the big plane parts. (Also making explosions)

Probably the first thing I'll do is figure out what I need to fix in all of my mods. I'll probably spend a week just updating things. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Should not be much of a wait ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) I try to have my stuff ready to go pretty briskly post-release.
> **Oh... and I'll be launching a new life support mod with 1.0** ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

You are a MACHINE ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

will definetly get it, especially if the tanks for resources (O2, Food, H20, etc) have visually interesting and unique models (ie: not boring, hard to differentiate flat tubes (ala TACLS)).

> 
> What will you do first in 1.0?

Learn the new aero model. Many of my rocket, spacecraft, and mission designs are based on aerodynamic simulations that I perform outside of the game. I'll have to learn how the new aero model works, modify my simulations, and develop new design guidelines.
Go out and finally explore the crap out of all those space rocks floating there without caring about fuel.

> 
> That is something you would expect, isn't it? We'll see. I'm still not convinced Squad's idea of "1.0" is the same as everyone else's.

So the first thing you would do is... Wait for version 1.0.1 to patch game breaking bugs on launch ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Me... I'd probably play for half an hour before I start shoving mods and tweaks up the engine's arse again... and laugh at the **x64** gripes about how the game crashes every 30 min... but people keep playing.

1) Re-optimize my SPH atmo craft files and spaceplanes for the new aero-model; learn the new aero-model and build tools/GUI

2) Restart career mode with the new tech tree, contracts, space center Tier, parts, re-balance, and whatever else has been added ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

3) Explosions....and then for a change of pace, more explosions.
Im going to restart my career now whit 200% more plane development!

Run for the fairings. Period.

(Aaand maybe a bit of exploring other stuff)
Definitely gonna fool around in career, since I hardly play sandbox or science mode. Gonna be fun with the new IVAs, and the female kerbonaut as well. Should add a bit more variety I suppose.
The gigantic SSTO designs I've built will get dusted off and upgraded with the new landing gear. Hopefully I will be able to fly them now.

I'll start a new sandbox game and build a bunch of random test craft to check out all the new parts and systems.

Then I'll check out the tutorials, and then start a new career to test out that portion of the game.
Finally visit every single planet in the system!
Play career for half an hour, get bored of it, then go back to sandbox. Might end up installing FAR again, depending how good the new aero is.
Make flying saucers with the new fairings? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Learn how to launch with new atmo. Then, it's time to see how the new aero will affect Eve.
